text: spring has sprung and it's time for me
to spring some new recipes on you first
up it's a creamy risotto with mushrooms
and spring herbs I've shown you how to
make risotto before I did an oven
version once I think that was really
good you can check out that video but
today I'm going to do the classic
stovetop method that results in the
creamiest most amazing risotto starting
off of course by cutting up my mushrooms
you'll need a half a pound of mushrooms
and you can quarter them or even cut
them into eighths if they're really big
white mushrooms cremini mushrooms or
even any kind of wild mushroom that you
can get your hands on delicious here now
everything else happens at the stove
you're going to want to build some
flavor by saut√©ing some shallots in
butter I have two tablespoons of
unsalted butter melt your butter and
then add a shallot that's been minced
this can be a little bit of white onion
or regular onion if you'd like instead
you can use the leeks you can use
scallions it's kind of up to you
then you can add your mushrooms you want
to start getting them a little bit
golden brown it can season with some
salt and pepper
don't over season at this point because
you're going to be adding broth which is
often seasoned and it gets reduced down
and down and down which intensifies the
saltiness you can always season again at
the end cook your mushrooms out just a
little bit about four minutes when the
mushrooms have softened just a little
bit you don't have to get them
completely completely cooked you can add
your rice it's a cup of arborio rice
which is the classic risotto rice there
are other Rice's that are like a little
fancier like carnaroli and via lonina no
but our Barrio is widely available and
really excellent for this dish stir it
around I want to get all your grains of
rice coated with a little bit of that
fat the butter and then you can add your
wine now this is optional if you don't
want to use the wine you don't have to
but it adds a really nice flavor
half a cup white wine nice and dry and
then what you want to do is just cook it
out until it evaporates almost
completely you can see that it's almost
completely absorbed / evaporated so you
can start adding your liquid what I have
is six cups of chicken broth that I've
brought to a simmer on the back of my
stove and you're going to start adding
the broth about a half a cup to a cup at
a time and then just continually
stirring until the risotto is cooked if
you want this dish to be vegetarian
because it's a mushroom dish you can use
vegetable broth so the key for classic
risotto is that you just add liquid a
little bit at a time and then cook
stirring pretty much continuously until
it's al dente that takes about 25 or 30
minutes so what you do is you cook until
most of this liquid is absorbed before
you add the next amount of liquid add a
little bit more you'll use anywhere from
like four and a half cups to six full
cups of liquid for this one cup of rice
you can see that it's much much thicker
now and most of the liquid is absorbed
what you're looking for is for the rice
to be tender with a tiny bit of bite but
not crunchy in the center and that's
when you can stop adding your liquid and
what I like to do is if I'm making this
ahead which you totally can cook it just
slightly less than done and spread it
out on a baking sheet to cool and then
when you want to reheat it just reheat
it with a little bit of broth it'll come
back to the texture that you like anyway
this is almost done so now you add your
finishing touches two more tablespoons
of butter stir that in for creaminess
flavor and then some grated Parmesan
cheese this is two tablespoons you can
use as much as you want you might want a
little bit more and then your fresh
herbs just spring it up I have some
chives I'm going to add a little bit of
that and
some chopped parsley dill would be nice
tarragon chervil whatever you like with
mushrooms a little bit of fresh thyme or
marjoram would also be really nice and
look at that doesn't get any springier
than that you know what else you could
put in here two extra spring apply it
some asparagus you can add that at the
very end mmm spring it up with spring
herb risotto I like it if it's nice and
loose some people like it a little
stiffer just keep hooking it a little
bit I promise you it will stiffen up
really really quickly but come on guys
this is amazing and it's a classic it's
spring herb and mushroom risotto
mmm so fresh delicious
